website_summaries.verdict: Feature-heavy golf watch with advanced GPS for better tracking and international course information.
pros: Pre-loaded with over 30,000 worldwide courses and free lifetime updates
Battery life is 3 weeks watch mode/up to 8 hours with GPS
Advanced GPS receiver for tracking under trees
cons: GPS does not always hold charge, and software may glitch

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Garmin Approach S2 on 8 different occasions. It functioned perfectly on only one occasion. On four occasion is functioned perfectly for 9 holes then would only provide yardage from the tee box and would not track play on the last 9 holes. On three other occasions it worked intermittently and provided inaccurate yardage. I have updated the software but results did not improve. I would like to have this unit replaced or my money refunded. The performance is unacceptable. W H Smith W H Smith
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY Life is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I live in Wisconsin so we don't get to golf year round. So this watch was used about 10 months total (in two years of owning it). The battery does not last more than 2 years. The battery starts degrading quickly. Toward the end of the second year of owning this watch it would run out of a charge before a 4 hour round was up (after being fully charged). Too expensive for such a short life. And after watching a video on "How to replace the battery" I decided that was not worth my time and money and moved onto a different brand (Bushnell). Will not buy Garmin brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Glad I ordered this model - ordered one for my husband and myself (in the white color) - a replacement for one that quite recharging properly - didn't need the model with all the bells and whistles - my husband has a hand-held range finder that he looks through as well that gives all the details - I don't need all that info - I basically want to know yardage as accurately as possible and this fits the bill - my husband loves his too - very easy to set up and very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Knows what course you're on and which hole you're on. The only thing it doesn't do, and this is not a surprise, the specs are clear and accurate, is display your score as you play. I use a scorecard for that anyway because it's easy and I like to see it all at a glance. You can see your score, if you choose to use the watch for that, from your computer later. When I compare the distances the S2 gives with my a smart phone app or someone elses GPS or the markers on the course, it's very accurate. Free lifetime updates is a big deal for me and Garmin provides that. It's easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in CO

customer_reviews.title: Provides all I need, for a great price...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is not a fancy GPS with 3D color graphics that does everything but swing the club for you...but it does exactly what it should, and it does it very well. It gives accurate yardage to the green, it's a snap to use (start it at the beginning of your round, then all I do is glance at my wrist when I need it), it's very comfortable to wear (like any other digital athletic-style watch, and I likely won't lose it! I don't have a comment on the battery life, as I only wear it on golf days, and it lasts fine for a round. For the price, I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Collins

customer_reviews.title: avoid! battery problems
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this! battery life is terrible. It was replaced once under warranty by Garmin, got it back, charged up once and when we went to try to use it, it failed again to turn on. Seems to be unable to hold a charge. I suspect this is either a poor design or problems with bad batteries. Now attempting to get Garmin
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my game.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. The battery life is great. Before the round I turn it on, it finds the course I am on and downloads it. I used to use my phone and it always ran our power, plus I could barely see it. Now I walk to my ball check my wrist and select my club. One of my golf partners has a handheld GPS and on a couple of occasions we were different by a yard. Also compared it to Bushnell RangeFinder and again was close. A yard or two plus or minus is not going to affect my game! If you are looking for something easy to use and accurate, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Dakotahjoe

customer_reviews.title: Purchased watch 9/16. Used it approx. 4 times ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased watch 9/16. Used it approx. 4 times, last time I used it it went blank mid-round, now it will not hold a charge. Contacted Garmin customer support and sending it back. Check out the history on the Garmin and it's charging problems before purchasing, I should have! I'll see if Garmin replaces.
customer_reviews.author: K. Christian

customer_reviews.title: Nice GPS
customer_reviews.text: Great GPS device and accurate too. Its easy to use, but I find that you have to manually set it to the hole you are starting. There are quite a few times we tee off on the back nine first and the Garmin does not adjust to the correct hole on its own. According to the manual it is supposed to be automatic. That is the only thing I found wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F Glynn

customer_reviews.title: Not Mac compatible to get updates - ought to have this info more prominently displayed
customer_reviews.text: Very irritated that in order to get the 4x/year free updates you have to have an IBM PC running Windows XP or later. Nowhere in the description of the golf watch does it say this, you have to go to the update web site to discover this. Had I known this was not Mac compatible I might not have bought this item. We were able to bypass the update alert screen on the watch and load a golf course so presumably it will work with what's already loaded but we ought to be able to take advantage of the full functionality including updates.
customer_reviews.author: cyssf

customer_reviews.title: So So Product (Not Happy)
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to receive Garmin GPS, I was disappointed the first times I used it. All the measurements were way off. I found I had to turn it off and set it up again to try to get the measurements correct, but it was so screwed up. Luckily I had another GPS in my golf bag which did work well. I was going to send it back, but I really don't want to be bothered. I have learned to do my homework before I buy another Golf GPS again.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn Brown

customer_reviews.title: Product I got is great for cleaning furniture
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could tell you whether the S2 I ordered from Jay-Tech is as good or better than the S1 I lost after many years. Leaving on golf trip in two days so paid for one day shipping. Package arrived on time, but contained only a package of Pledge Lemon Enhancing wipers. No GPS watch, no time to reorder, no GPS on golf trip. Somewhere, someone who ordered some cleaning wipes is puzzling over the watch (s)he received instead. Hope that person is a golfer! Avoid this careless seller
customer_reviews.author: MartyK

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on these
customer_reviews.text: Less then 2 years old, very minimal usage and always kept charged this thing is dead. Will not charge, blank screen, going to the trash! Do not waste your money on these. There are much better apps out there for you cell phone and they are FREE!
customer_reviews.author: DavyP

customer_reviews.title: Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to do. Giving me great service, so far, and I haven't experienced any battery short life issues, as some other reviewers have reported. Easy to set up. Periodically updating its golf course database online using the Garmin Express web application is a snap. A good wipe down after each round is all I do to help keep the charging port contacts clean. Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Improve your game with one investment.
customer_reviews.text: What a super improvement to my game. This watch/GPS is very well made and has so many functions I doubt I'll ever use them all. It is so easy to operate that I was able to go out the next day and play using it. You don't notice it on your wrist, but it sure does make shot selections better. Won't go out on the course without it again. I have three GPS's by Garmin and every one of them works great and gets me to the spot I programmed every time.
customer_reviews.author: Ionecalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, long-lasting and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch several months ago and have used it for at least 20 rounds of golf. At full charge, this watch will allow you to play a full 18 and can sometimes last another full 18 if the first round went well. It's comfy, easy to use, and looks good. I recommend this to anyone wanting a simple GPS watch
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Garmin approach
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product didn’t work very long, it will not load courses after about 6 moths of use. Called Garmin and the only thing they would do is sell us another one, so now it sits in the closet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Golf GPS
customer_reviews.text: This unit works seamlessly. My wife turns it on when she goes to whatever course she is playing and it finds the course. It is somewhat confusing for the non-technical person. It provides front, back and middle of the green. That is all my wife wanted from a golf GPS. It is much more convenient than the Callaway hand held unit she used previously. The unit has more features but they add a level of complexity that a non-technical person probably doesn't want to use.
customer_reviews.author: William Bentrim

customer_reviews.title: This device really helps my game
customer_reviews.text: I can generally hit the ball a specific distance - if I know what it is. This watch is very accurate - I have checked it against GPS devices in golf carts. It doesn't know if the pin is front or back, but tells you where front is and middle and warns where back is. I also accidentally swam with it on one day - I don't recommend that, but it did much better than a Kindle I dropped into a spa once! Really good device and you don't have to pay more every year for new courses - they are included as long as you plug into computer at night.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H. Kolman

customer_reviews.title: Simple and good price
customer_reviews.text: Simple and a great price for golf GPS. Definitely better than my phone app that would have issues when we lost service in mountain areas. Simple enough that we bought one for my father and father-in-law as gifts. It would be nice to have some color on the display but for the price, I can live with just black font
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Damn fine piece of golf equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is the best range finder I ever used on the golf course. The distances sometimes are conflicting with the course's own measurements, but who can say which is the more accurate? The Garmin is the most consistent, if not the most accurate device I've ever used on the course.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Finance

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this! Great on course gadget for distance control and course management
customer_reviews.text: We have used some of the hand held GPS devices but got tired of the fees and the inconvenience of having to carry something with you, especially when it is cart path only. This watch is a gem! I accidentally bought a black one but that one quickly got a place on my husband's arm! He was sold right away. So I ordered the white one. I never leave home for a round without this puppy on my arm. It really helps to know the exact yardage you are from the pin from where you are standing by your ball. What more can i say? Thanks Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: J. Champagne

customer_reviews.title: For simple pleasures
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a rangefinder that was simple to use. I wasn't concerned about lots of features, just distance to the hole. This does that great. I've also used the distance to front/back readout and length of drive. The startup is pretty straight forward. I play at a club where a round of 18 may be from the combination of two different named 9-hole courses. This unit knows the sequence of play and if I start on the right course, the watch just continues onto the correct course. The buttons are of course straight forward to use. If you just want to know how far to the hole, this does that the way you wish your mechanic would fix the car.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful tool.
customer_reviews.text: Good, accurate GPS watch. I've had some difficulties with some of the more advanced features but I am mostly interested in the yardage to the front, center, and back of the greens. I find this very helpful. I also had trouble turning it off, but that function has been resolved. Wish the battery indicator would stay on permanently. I purchased the white watch because someone remarked that it was easier to read the display, though I can't understand why.
customer_reviews.author: RedEagle

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied so far with the watch. It finds my course very fast and seems to be pretty consistant with yardages. I do wish it had more detailed information for layups and hazzards but with a little simple math I can usually figure it out. Better than paying a yearly fee! It does take a long time to charge but who plays golf at night? If you are looking for a basic golf GPS product, this is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Elvish

customer_reviews.title: Great golf gps
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for my husband. He golfed 2 days after Christmas. He was impressed with it. Only problem is, he is left handed and if he wears it on that arm, when he. Swings the club, the bend in his wrist bumps the buttons. He either has to wear it higher on his arm or use it on right hand
customer_reviews.author: Ellen G

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in 2016 probably used it 10 times since my purchase, now its completely dead, not sure if there is a battery to replace or if it just stopped working. I liked it a lot when it was working
customer_reviews.author: daniel yeager

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: While it performs as advertised , the manual enclosed is very vague - could be better. It tells you how to scroll menu, then tells you "select" without telling you how to select. Through trial and error I discovered it was done with a double tap on button 4. On some occasions on the course I have found it necessary to update the hole #, still haven't found out if this is a glitch or error on my part. Overall, 10x better than the Sky Caddy wristwatch I used before. Plus no yearly fees----Yay!!
customer_reviews.author: jerry bound

customer_reviews.title: It just needs a better operator.
customer_reviews.text: Since I don't pay golf every week it that's me a while to remember the setting when going to a new golf course. If I used it two or three times a week I am sure I would get faster. Otherwise it dose everything that it was advertise to do. It just needs a better operator.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Coulter

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Golf Watch
customer_reviews.text: I am very dissapointed with this purchase. The equipment is not Working properly. I did not return it because I threw Away the original pack. It Seems like I got a refurbished product. I do not Want To think about it since I am a frequent Amazon buyer and I do not Want To loose my confidence. Nonetheless I feel bad Please advise me Thanks and kind regards José Rivas
customer_reviews.author: jose puerta

customer_reviews.title: Not okay, then okay.
customer_reviews.text: The watch worked well for two weeks then quit. I called Garmin customer service and a helpful young man talked me through how to correct the problem and log in all of the latest course data. Now it works well, but I wish it had been set up properly when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Three putter

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money! Battery died!
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money! Battery died after 10 rounds of golf. Replacement battery requires micro soldering tools and skills. I don't mind replacing plug and play batteries. Maybe use replacement watch style batteries in your next redesign!!!! Seriously, This is a product coming from a tech company???
customer_reviews.author: John Hannam

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome watch. I have only 1 issue. Sometimes in the sun you can see a reflected beam coming from the glass of the watch. Only at certain times of the day, or angles you are hitting, but nonetheless I see it. Mostly when you putt the light spot moves back and forth on the grass....oh and distance to all hazards would be nice. Otherwise this watch is well worth it IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Pondplayer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate distances, good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life. Seems accurate on the few courses I play on. Would be nice if it gave the distance to hazards. A little heavy compared to a regular watch made of plastic, but to be expected since it has a GPS inside.
customer_reviews.author: luvboating

customer_reviews.title: The best part ironically is its simplicity!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful watch for my golf-aholic dad who isn't very tech-savvy. It tells him what he needs to know -- the distance to the hole from where he's standing. The best part ironically is its simplicity: it gives you what you need to know and allow you to enjoy the game and not stare down at a mini screen to avoid mistakes. The fact that these are allowed in most amateur tournaments (as they do not give too much information) makes it far more a bargain than the newer S4s and S6s.
customer_reviews.author: Kure

customer_reviews.title: Had a Skycaddie that I was very happy with for over 10 years
customer_reviews.text: Had a Skycaddie that I was very happy with for over 10 years. Battery died, so I got the S2. Little concerned about wearing a watch, but it is no problem. Does all I need it to do and is very comfortable. Would recommend. No more annual costs for downloads.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Garmin for my husband and he absolutely loves it! He said that it works so well. He had a hand held before and had to type in the course and it would have to locate it. With the Garmin Approach, you simply turn it on and it finds the course automatically. I would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie W

customer_reviews.title: Serenity now!
customer_reviews.text: My wife begged me for this for an entire year until I surprised her with it for her Christmas gift. First time she wore it it only lasted 3 holes and the battery died. We didnt charge it properly though so that was our bad. Next 3 times we played she forgot to wear it. Serenity now!!
customer_reviews.author: CRB

customer_reviews.title: Meets Expectations
customer_reviews.text: My husband chose this over others that were similar, based on price, the mostly good reviews and having had Garmin products before and we were happy with them. He says it meets all his expectations. It works good. It's simple to operative. He's glad he purchased it and does recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Really like this watch
customer_reviews.text: Really like this watch...really believe it has helped my game. You get so reliant on it for your distances, many times it's an eyeopener knowing the exact distance. Very easy to download off the site and all courses I've played have easily come up. Very easy to master as far as the workings of the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bassic watch
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. had to return the first one, couldn't link with satellite. Second watch works great. Played 2 rounds 4:15 each round on one charge, yes it died on my as I was putting the last hole. Distances were accurate verified by other playing partners range finder and watch. Gives you the basic information which is what I was looking for, front middle back and will even measure my shot. I want to play golf and not fiddle with a watch and this watch allows me to do just that.
customer_reviews.author: Dudley CA

customer_reviews.title: I love it, works great
customer_reviews.text: I love it, works great, loads course as soon as i get close, simple, yet gives me all the info i really need, very comfortable, dont even know its there, very handy, no more walking around looking for yardage markers, should hav bought one years ago
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Has been great. Cannot figure out how to find distance to ...
customer_reviews.text: Has been great. Cannot figure out how to find distance to hazards, though. That is the only shortcoming. Very accurate at distance to green/pin, etc. Has many other nice features like shot distance and odometer for step count. Also tells time :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch.
customer_reviews.text: I have this same model watch & I love it. I purchased this one for my husband because he had problems with another brand. Not only is the watch a winner, but i have found that Garmin has excellent customer service. I broke one that was out of warranty and they offered significant discount on a new one when I returned the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Garskof

customer_reviews.title: 2 work great!! my husband and father n law love ...
customer_reviews.text: So we bought 3 of these watches for gifts. 2 work great!! my husband and father n law love it. Sadly the 3rd one will not hold charge off the charger. As soon as its taken off the charger it dies. This was bought in Nov. 2016 and the person who we bought it for just tried to use it for the first time. I sent the company an email with no response thus far for potential exchange.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: Quick and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've used the S2 6 times without incident. I thought wearing a watch like device during a round would interfere with my swing but it did not. I have only used the yardage to the pin function and found it to be fast and accurate. The instructions are somewhat lacking. It took a little time to figure out how to shut down the S2 as the instructions were not clear. Once I figured it out it turned out to be a simple procedure. The initial set-up was easy and charging the S2 is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: Nice GPS for price.
customer_reviews.text: I am partial to Garmin golf GPS watches. This is my second. Only knock is that I can only get one full round before it needs charging.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Pirillo

customer_reviews.title: Garmin golf watch S2
customer_reviews.text: This product was sold by Gears4less through Amazon. It stated that the watch was "NEW" when in fact it was a refurbished watch as I recently found out from Garmin. I would not recommend buying anything through Gears4less.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn McKie

customer_reviews.title: ... information that I returned it and bought the Garminwatch. Does exactly what I want - distance front ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought a hand held laser range finder and was frustrated with focusing and trying to read the information that I returned it and bought the Garmin watch. Does exactly what I want - distance front center and back. Took getting used to the first time as the instruction manual was not the best and the buttons on the watch have microscopic lettering as to what they do.
customer_reviews.author: UALPilot

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift to our grandson and one yo ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to our grandson and one yo our son. They adore the convenience of being able to gauge the distance of the ball lie to the hole. Garmin has proven to be a superb product in other areas as well
customer_reviews.author: Heide Katros

customer_reviews.title: Awesome must have
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a must! Never guess how far out you are ever again. Matched up with an expensive gps and was the same distance every time. Def would recommend. A lot of reviews said bad battery but I have never had it die on me while playing.
customer_reviews.author: Chowda

customer_reviews.title: What it lacks in precision it makes up for in  convenience
customer_reviews.text: This product is very useful. We rarely use the handheld rangefinder anymore because what this lacks in precision it makes up for in convenience. It does not show you how far it is to the pin, only how far to the front, back, and middle of the green. This is close enough for me and I don't have to fool around with digging the rangefinder out, just look at my wrist. It is also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy F.

customer_reviews.title: VERY CONVENIENT
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight (you don't even know you are wearing it). It's always "with you) no need to ever go back to your cart or bag which might happen with another device. So far it seems pretty accurate with yardages. The only downside is that you have to press buttons numerous times to get your course to load.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Emmett

customer_reviews.title: This is a great simple yardage watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great simple yardage watch. Gives yardages to the front middle and back of green. The scorecard function has to be started on hole 1 but after that will ask for a score at the end of each hole. This watch is perfect if you just want yardages to the green. If you want more detail, you need to look for another watch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Father's Day gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is an early Father's Day gift for my husband who loves to golf. He also has a thing for watches. He is very happy with this watch. This is his watch so I am unsure how it works plus I do not golf but he loves it and thinks that it is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: movielover

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Easy to charge. Has made a significant improvement in my golf game as I have found that my previous yardage estimates were often off by 10-15 yards. I'm thrilled with the product. It's large but lightweight and comfortable to wear. I'm a 5'1" woman. I've received lots of compliments on the green band! Very cool!
customer_reviews.author: Linda R

customer_reviews.title: Was able to download Course updates very easily. Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used it yesterday. Was able to download Course updates very easily. Very easy to use. Much much better than my previous order of the Pyle 605 that I returned, which couldn't hold a candle to the Garmin. Also the Garmin is much more comfortable to wear, buttons easier to push to reach other functions. Less expensive isn't always better.
customer_reviews.author: G. D. Self

customer_reviews.title: He uses the white plug in adapter from his IPhone and that works great, no connecting it to the computer that way ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, and all I know to say is that he likes it a lot and wears it every time he goes Golfing. He uses the white plug in adapter from his IPhone and that works great, no connecting it to the computer that way so no problems with it charging. He has no complains with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: mogirl

customer_reviews.title: No frills watch at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my S1 with the S2. I like the international courses being included. No frills golf watch for a lower end price. Only wish the battery lasted longer. Need to charge the watch between each round to be sure you won't go dead on the second 18. Some of the newer models appear to have better battery life. Otherwise very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John Ring

customer_reviews.title: ... a couple of years and it is still working fine. The biggest problem was that the band broke ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the S1 for a couple of years and it is still working fine. The biggest problem was that the band broke and there is no way to replace it, making the device all but useless unless you carried it in your pocket.. The S2 is a huge improvement as you can replace the band (and eventually it will break just like the S1) So far, this S2 works great and is simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Halpin

customer_reviews.title: Works good for the average golfer.
customer_reviews.text: It measures the distance fairly accurately. The score keeping function works okay. You must go around the white tee box for it to recognize which hole you are at. Used it 4 times, figured as I use it more I will be faster with the different functions.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Be aware
customer_reviews.text: Had to send this Garmin back because it was off about 100 yards on most of the holes even though it said it was reading my home course. I tried shutting it down twice to start over, et it was inaccurate each time.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Yardages are accurate and courses are fine. Problem is that it does not give yardages ...
customer_reviews.text: Yardages are accurate and courses are fine. Problem is that it does not give yardages to hazards (sand, water, etc.). I have seen others that do and would recommend them over the Garmin. Knowing distances to hazards is just as important as distance to the green.
customer_reviews.author: Pat M.

customer_reviews.title: This watch is easy to use and I love the scoring and having ...
customer_reviews.text: The yardage can be different among 3 watches. We all stood together and we all have a different yardage but only by 1 or two yards. This watch is easy to use and I love the scoring and having the ability to upload to my Garmin site to keep track of my scores.
customer_reviews.author: D.D.

customer_reviews.title: an affordable wrist device that's reliable and easy to use on the golf course to measure my ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I was looking for...an affordable wrist device that's reliable and easy to use on the golf course to measure my distance to the pin and keep my score if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Marie

customer_reviews.title: The info with the Garmin Approach S2 GPS Golf Watch ...
customer_reviews.text: The info with the Garmin Approach S2 GPS Golf Watch wasn't clear enough for me so I ordered this and didn't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Whipped cream

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the size
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate yardage readings, I am very pleased with the size, light weight and comfortable fit. Only down side is battery life is great for 18 holes but runs out before 36. Easy to recharge using lap top data port which also connects with Garmin website for course updates. I would highly recommend because of the simplicity and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Everette Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Golf assistant
customer_reviews.text: Great Golf Watch. I love this watch. Love that you can use the green or black band. Keeps a charge, pretty accurate within a yard or two vs the cart gps. Everyone asks me the yardage when we are golfing. Its easy to use, wear and simply wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: GolfGirl

customer_reviews.title: Charge easily lasts for well over 18 holes
customer_reviews.text: Directions were not very clear, but works very well after you figure it out. Tried to use an app on my cell phone, but could not see it very well in the sun. Np problem with the watch. Charge easily lasts for well over 18 holes.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished product
customer_reviews.text: Never performed properly. Probably never refurbished. Will have to just throw away...
customer_reviews.author: MEP

customer_reviews.title: Just give me the yardage!
customer_reviews.text: I'm familiar with the Garmin products, this is an upgrade for me. I live in the Midwest so I haven't gotten a chance to use this one on the golf course yet.
customer_reviews.author: Golfnifecenc

customer_reviews.title: battery life still works 1 year later.
customer_reviews.text: battery life still works 1 year later, to get me through full 4 hour round.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife had a chance to use it for the ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife had a chance to use it for the first time thid past week in North Carolina. The first course she loaded, the Maples at Seatrails in Sunset Beach, NC. did not work properly. the yardages did not track with the holes. She will try it again while we are in Florida for the next 2 months. If problems continue, we will need to return it. Tom Herwig
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery very poor!
customer_reviews.text: Got this watch on May 16th. I just golfed my fourth round today with it. I charge prior to each round and only made it to 14th hole today and it died. Like the watch but battery is not good. Of course I'm over 30 days so now I'm out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cantile

customer_reviews.title: Garmin S2 Golf Watch for "Wifey"
customer_reviews.text: Garmin S2 does everything my wife wants it to do. She was replacing a Bushnell golf watch that somehow stopped connecting to the charger unit (poor design - small tiny pins that often need cleaning on the watch iteself) No charge, no work! Bushnell's design looks more substantial with 1/32" charging connections. Large numbers are easily read in bright sunshine or low light. The purple color is a bonus for her!!!
customer_reviews.author: San Francisco Golfer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Unit
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. It's fast and reliable. Nitpicks would be the size (quite bulky) and the battery life isn't terrific, but I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Pecqueur

customer_reviews.title: Great golf watch
customer_reviews.text: This does all the work for you in terms of locating the course you are on and your distance from front, center and back of greens. Also provide distance from key yardage markers and keeps your score. It can take a few extra clicks to move from hole to hole or ads score at time but still really like it.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Use it every time I golf. Works great and holds the charge well.
customer_reviews.author: Rainey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment of the Garmin Approach S2 GPS Golf watch.
customer_reviews.text: It takes too many hours to charge this watch. And the battery does not last more than 8 hours as claimed. It is only less than 8 months of my purchase. Is there any way that I can get a replacement of any other model of Garmin made. I do not mind topping up for the difference in price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this item. The yardages for the courses I have played so far are right on. So nice to look at my wrist, see the yardage, pull a club and hit...no searching for sprinklerheads and yardage plates. Doesn't interfere with my swing or wrist cock. The best golf aid I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: phrankie tee

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very unreliable. If you get a year out of them that will be about it. Battery technology used is very poor. I like the convenience of a watch, but I'll switch to a range finder now. $200 for a years use is out of line.
customer_reviews.author: BigMax

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Like this golf watch, but it is stuck in German and I can't get it back to English. Still works, but frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good GPS, but rust is an issue
customer_reviews.text: Watch works great. Front, back, middle yardages. My only issue with watch is that it rusts around all the buttons and screws. Have played 8-10 rounds with it, never in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: First GPS golf watch I bought. No complaints here. Comfortable to wear. The draw back is that I am at lost when I forget to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gooseman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works around the world. The newer ones may have some cooler features but this unit is idiot proofed.
customer_reviews.author: Y. W. C.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: The distances seem to be pretty accurate. It is great because you can be anywhere on the golf course and know exactly how far out you are from the pin. I didn't give it 5 stars only because the battery gets drained somewhat quick using the gps for golf. It's fine for 18 holes if it's been charged but 36 holes is a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: GSmith922

customer_reviews.title: Right on!
customer_reviews.text: Have played 5 different courses in Colorado and all were just about spot on. Two of my golfing partners have GPS.. first a Garmin hand held and the other a Golf Buddy hand held and distances are within feet of each other...only I don't have to put mine back on the cart or in the bag! Extremely handy and ready to use. Very easy to read and with the exception of distances to a particular hazard, it is very functional. Worked great right out of the box, but if you want the latest updates, you must have Visio or later Microsoft software on your pc. All in all a great buy..
customer_reviews.author: Pete C.

customer_reviews.title: Love using this GPS Watch!
customer_reviews.text: I also own the S1 Approach GPS watch and love using both items. The S2 seems to have more battery life and is more comfortable to wear. S2 also includes more pre-loaded courses. Several of my golf buddies have purchased some version of a GPS watch after seeing mine. It's great to always know the distance to the green, very helpful when I am within 200 yards and especially for 30 or 40 yard approach shots.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Ansell

customer_reviews.title: I thought I needed one of the larger handheld units ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought I needed one of the larger handheld units to get the right information quickly. Well, I was wrong. This small watch does the same thing and all it takes is a quick glance at your wrist. So if you want distance to the front, middle, and back of a green, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: garmin s2 golf watch
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple to use. It gives the yardage it says compared with sprinkler heads etc. Had a software problem, had to wait for customer service but once connected they fixed the problem. Battery life not too good. Will not make it through two rounds.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not hold up for the entire 18 holes ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery does not hold up for the entire 18 holes sometimes. The GPS really burns through the battery. Has to be fully charged before playing.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My wife is addicted to it. really has helped her golf game.
customer_reviews.author: Real Estate person. 11111

customer_reviews.title: Gps watch
customer_reviews.text: Good watch. Doesn't give yardage to hazards. Otherwise I would have given it five stars
customer_reviews.author: ChrisH

customer_reviews.title: The GPS portion works great. But the battery life sucks so it makes ...
customer_reviews.text: The GPS portion works great. But the battery life sucks so it makes it worthless. I tried to watch twice . a full charge only last two and a half hours. A round of golf is at least for four and a half hours..do the math
customer_reviews.author: Donzell Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Nice not to have something clipped to your hip
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and convenient. Nice not to have something clipped to your hip. Very comfortable and easier than I thought to use.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas present!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this device for a round of golf and is very pleased with it. He said that the instructions provided were easy to read and understand. It was easy to set up and use. It gave him accurate distance on the golf course and he credits it with helping to improve his game.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch.
customer_reviews.text: It has been a pleasant surprise. I didn't think it would work as well as it does. Great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Williams

customer_reviews.title: I bought this just a little over a year ago ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just a little over a year ago and now the battery just died and does not hold a charge. Charged it overnight before a golf round and it didn't last 18 holes.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Marquette

customer_reviews.title: He loves that it is a watch and does a better job than other than his other rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my husband and he absolutely loves it. He loves that it is a watch and does a better job than other than his other rangefinder. He is very hapy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Instant yardage on your wrist.
customer_reviews.text: This golf watch works as advertised. Yardage matches my friends laser rangefinders when we match the points being measured. The watch is preloaded with every course I checked or played, even two little pars three's. It loads courses quickly and provides constant yardage throughout the round. Haven't used for more than 18 holes on a single charge. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Wagner

product_meta.title: Garmin Approach S2 Black/Green
product_meta.description: Color:Black/Green| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingGarmin is excited to introduce a new model to our popular Approach S-series of golf watches -the Approach S2. With the golf world still buzzing over the successful Approach S-series, the stylish S2 is the perfect addition for the upcoming golf season. Now offering three fashionable color options, all with preloaded worldwide courses, the S2 provides a similar easy-to-use watch with a high-sensitivity GPS receiver in a lightweight, comfortable design. This trendy new addition also offers removable watch bands fastened by pins for a simple and enhanced fit. Golfers will get all of the amazing benefits of the S1; including precise yardage to the front, back and middle of the greens, ability to measure shot distances, and a course odometer. In addition, the S2 offers layup and dogleg distances to improve usability over the entire hole, plus a digital scorecard that is conveniently accessed by the user throughout the round. And there is no need for downloads or subscriptions -the S2 comes ready to go out of the box with over 30,000 preloaded worldwide courses and free lifetime course updates!
feature_bullets: Preloaded worldwide courses (over 30,000 courses worldwide) and free lifetime course updates
Battery life up to 3 weeks (watch mode); up to 8 hours (GPS mode)
High-sensitivity GPS receiver for stronger signal strength and improved tracking under trees
Provides precise yardages to front, back and middle of the green, Layup and dogleg distances improve usability for the entire hole
Measures individual shot distances -calculates precise yardage for shots played from anywhere on the course - An individual, digital scorecard that can be stored and printed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,924 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
